intro: Henningia afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan henningia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
